title: Who Are These Stylish People at Day 5 of Fashion Week?
text:
Photo: Liisa Jokinen Patrick Church , 27, artist & designer: “It was gloomy outside and I wanted to make my life a little bit better.”

Today’s crop of Fashion Week-goers includes the “eyes of Bergdorf Goodman” herself, Linda Fargo, as well as a family therapist in floral. Photographed outside shows like Gabriela Hearst, Christian Cowan, Eckhaus Latta, and Maryam Nassir Zadeh, the individuals below — stylists, editors, students, writers, designers, and influencers — agreed to share their style philosophies and influences with photographer Liisa Jokinen. Scroll down to see how their looks came together.

Rajni Lucienne Jacques, Fashion Director at Allure and Teen Vogue

Photo: Liisa Jokinen

“I’m wearing Jonathan Simkhai. Anything and everything inspires my style, especially other black people. My style philosophy: Be easy.”

Instagram: @rajni_jacques

Arin Hayes, Co-Director of No Sesso

Photo: Liisa Jokinen

“I chose to wear this outfit because it represents my brand but is still relaxed and comfortable. My style is inspired by either being super chill and lax or maximalist to the fullest. I don’t follow trends. I just wear what I want to wear.”

Instagram: @nosessola

Charlie Janelle, 28, Writer and Filmmaker

Photo: Liisa Jokinen

“The cashmere sweater is a Calvin Klein, the shorts are Dickies, loafers by Kiko Kostadinov, and the glasses my brother’s. I chose this outfit because I was set on wearing the sweater and needed to let my legs breathe. It’s still summer, after all.”

Instagram:@charliejanelle

Taylor Okata, 33, Stylist

Photo: Liisa Jokinen

“I’m wearing mostly vintage and CMMN SWDN. I woke up and just felt like wearing something representative of my culture — I’m from Hawaii. I also just got done styling a campaign that included horses, so I added a paniolo flair.”

Instagram: @taylorokata

Shi Stupart, 35, Family Therapist

Photo: Liisa Jokinen

“I’m wearing Forever 21, LF, and Anthropologie. I often wear floral patterns. Today I was inspired by the hot weather and the sun. My style philosophy: Express yourself.”

Instagram: @its.shi.like.shy

Reyna Demos, 26, Project Manager at Insidesource

Photo: Liisa Jokinen

“I’m wearing a 1995 Jean Paul Gaultier “Cyber” collection top, Eckhaus Latta pants, $2 thrift store mules, and vintage jewelry. I chose to wear this outfit today because I feel really good in it. My style philosophy: Unfortunately clothing is not always optional, so we might as well dress up and dress expressively.”

Instagram: @reynademos

Chloe King, 31, Fashion Office at Bergdorf Goodman

Photo: Liisa Jokinen

“I’m wearing a Jonathan Cohen dress, Maison Margiela pants, The Row bag, and a vintage necklace. I’ve loved this dress since I saw it on the runway in February. Every last detail is heaven. Jonathan is so talented and his pieces always capture his spirit. My style philosophy: Trust your instincts and take chances. You never know what you’ll love until you try it on.”

Instagram: @chloe4dayz

Janka Polliani, 40, Television Host and Influencer

Photo: Liisa Jokinen

“I’m wearing a Dries Van Noten set with Bottega Veneta shoes and bag. Casual and perfect for the NYC heat. I get inspired by the people I surround myself with. My style philosophy: Dress up like there is no tomorrow.”

Instagram: @polliani

Brandon Veloria, 33, Co-Founder of James Veloria

Photo: Liisa Jokinen

“I’m wearing a John Galliano plaid top, Jean Paul Gaultier button up, Miu Miu bag, and Eckhaus Latta jeans and shoes. I had the stomach flu yesterday and wanted to show my midriff. Working in vintage I’m constantly inspired by what comes in. I dress like it’s my first day of school everyday.”

Annabel Rosendahl, 30, Stylist and Influencer

Photo: Liisa Jokinen

“I’m wearing a Chloé top, AGOLDE jeans, Dior bag, and Bottega Veneta shoes. After a very neutral fashion week I felt like wearing colors. I’m inspired by my friends, and by scrolling through Instagram. My style philosophy: Dress for yourself, not everyone else!”

Instagram: @annabelrosendahl

Linda Fargo, SVP of the Fashion Office and Director of Women’s Fashion and Store Presentation for Bergdorf Goodman

Photo: Liisa Jokinen

“I’m wearing a Zimmermann balloon blouse and deconstructed khakis from Phillip Lim. My shoes are an exclusive made for Bergdorf Goodman by Wandler. I walk the line between practical and impractical. Drama and utility. Statement and understatement. I have always been a leopard devotee, especially when it’s paired back to a hit of red, hence the lips! I like to be impulsive and intuitive in my style choices and rarely stick with a plan. Plans are meant to be broken, no?”

Instagram: @lindafargo

Coco Romack, 26, Writer

Photo: Liisa Jokinen

“My jacket and earrings are by Acne Studios, dress by Pleats Please Issey Miyake, boots by Maison Margiela, bag by Simone Rocha. Gallery girls inspire my style. My philosophy: It’s all about the earrings.”

Angela Qehaja, 20, Junior Fashion Stylist

Photo: Liisa Jokinen

“I’m wearing a total denim look by Levi’s, Fendi vintage bag, vintage archive vest, BUFFALO London boots, sunglasses from Groupies Vintage, and a Prada hair pin. When I get dressed, I don’t see myself as a model. I see myself for who I am, and I am happy in the clothes I wear because they express me in every way possible. That’s what pulled me into the fashion universe in the first place.”

Instagram: @angelaqehaja

Madeline Swanson, 28, Accessories Editor at Vogue

Photo: Liisa Jokinen

“I’m wearing KkCo silk tie-dye shirt, J. Crew skirt circa 2008, Teva sandals, Trademark bag, Lizzie Fortunato earrings. My family inspires my style! My mom was a stylist and my grandmother made all her own clothes. I love handmade and vintage pieces (especially the ones that came from their closets). Trends change but everything you love or have loved is worth keeping because it will come back! Every day is an opportunity to explore and experiment with an old piece you haven’t worn in awhile.”

Instagram: @madmadder

Alexandra Kennedy, 29, Designer

Photo: Liisa Jokinen

“I’m wearing Eckhaus Latta, vintage from Templo, Vivienne Tam, vintage shoes and bag.”

Instagram: @poenaexcess

Celenie Laura Fleur Seidel, 30, Senior Womenswear Editor at Farfetch

Photo: Liisa Jokinen

“I’m wearing a Marc Jacobs shirt, Wales Bonner pants, Rejina Pyo shoes, and The Vampire’s Wife bag. I chose to wear this outfit because I’m really feeling the resurgence of the cargo pant! In terms of fashion inspiration generally, I’m most inspired by combinations of unexpected elements… when things kind of look a bit weird or off but in a great way. My style philosophy: Embrace newness and change in fashion, just find a way to personalize it and make it fit in your own aesthetic. It’s never worth it if you don’t feel like yourself.”

Instagram: @relrel

Niamh Galea, 24, MFA Candidate and Designer

Photo: Liisa Jokinen

“I’m wearing an Eckhaus Latta peach floral mesh Lapped Baby two-piece from Spring/Summer 2017, Ramp Tramp Tramp Stamp uber-high-waisted underwear, a lingerie dress that I made, and Nike sneakers that I found at Bronte Beach in Sydney one summer night last year. The Tuza bag was a gift from my friend, and so were the hair clips and the knitted belt thing. This is my first Eckhaus Latta show — I interned for the brand in 2017. My style is inspired by myself, L.A. thots, skater boys, my grandmother, and art mums.”

Instagram: @ramptramptrampstamp

Priyesh Patel, 26, Writer

Photo: Liisa Jokinen

“I’m wearing suede trousers from a vintage store in London, a top from Weekday, a hat from a vintage store in NYC, bag by Theo Adamson, ring by Georgia Kemball, and shoes by Kiko Kostadinov for Camper. I chose to wear this outfit randomly from a small selection of clothing I’ve brought to New York from London. Also I like the prints clashing together. My style is inspired by clothes. I’ll find random nice things I like in different places and put them together with things I like.”

Instagram: @p_riyesh
description: Liisa Jokinen shoots New Yorkers with fearless personal style at her site NYC-Looks. For the Cut, she photographed the best street style at shows for Gabriela Hearst, Christian Cowan, and Eckhaus Latta at New York Fashion Week Spring 2020.
